alert.note: Alert for Franklin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 14 at 7:32PM EDT until April 15 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Franklin, Halifax, Nash and Warren. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 730 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is expected in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Red Oak, Castalia, Centerville, Aventon, Arcola, Medoc Mountain State Park, Glenview and Airlie. - This includes the following flood prone locations... Big Peachtree Creek at Stallings Mill Rd and Porter Creek and Little Fishing Creek at Hwy 561. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
